title: Greetings from Wollongong
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Cities and towns - Australia
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Cities and towns
abstract: A study of unemployment and an exploration of one of Australia's largest industrial cities.
description: Four unemployed young people roam around one of Australia's largest industrial cities. Combines social realist fiction with an essay-like examination of the city of Wollongong. This film is equally engaging and intellectually rigorous. As an exploration of a once leading steel-producing city, now increasingly blighted by unemployment, it also becomes a requiem for post-war working class Australia.
related_objects: Collection; B1004060; AFI Collection - Curatorial; Active
